default: (a) a {@item light crossbow|PHB} and {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|PHB|20 bolts} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|PHB}, (b) a {@item scholar's pack|PHB}, or (c) any two {@table tools|PHB}

classFeature.name: Manifest
entries: You can transform into a manifestation of a more inhuman mockery of yourself and your essence. On your turn, you can transform into your form as a bonus action. Additionally, you gain the Shapeshifter subtype.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked {@condition unconscious}, reach 0 hit points, or die. You can also end your transformation as a bonus action. Once you have transformed the number of times shown for your vessel's level in the Transformations column of the Vessel table, you must finish a long rest before you can transform again.
While you are transformed, the following rules apply:

items: Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the essence, but you retain your ability scores and senses. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies.

When you transform, you assume the form's hit points and you share hit dice with the form. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. However, if you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. For example, if you take 10 damage in this form and have only 1 hit point left, you revert and take 9 damage. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you aren't knocked {@condition unconscious}.

You can't cast spells. Transforming doesn't break your concentration on a spell you've already cast, however, or prevent youfrom taking actions that are part of a spell, such as {@spell confusion}, that you've already cast.
You retain the benefits of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so.
Your form deals a {@dice 1d8} in damage it makes with its attacks, included in its statblock. This die changes as you gain vessel levels, as shown in the Form Strike column of the Vessel table.

You can choose whether your equipment falls to the ground in your space, merges into your new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the DM decides whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, based on the creature's shape and size. Your equipment doesn't change size or shape to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge with it. Equipment that merges with the form has no effect until you leave the form.

classFeature.name: Uncanny Emergence
entries: At 1st level, you choose the path that bests defines how you gained and command your essence. Choose Unhinged Alchemist, Altered Mage, or Primal Curse. The uncanny emergence you choose grants you features at 1st level and again at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th level.

In addition, you choose an essence that represents the nature and capabilities of your form. The Brute, Lycan, Araneae, Horned, Avian, and Aquatic. The essence you choose grants your form's statblock additional traits and attributes at 9th and 15th level.

classFeature.name: Dual Minds
entries: Starting at 3rd level, the being within you pairs with your mind, giving it strength. You have advantage against being {@condition frightened} and {@condition charmed}. You also have advantage against effects that would change your memories and emotions.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Uncanny Emergence feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Uncanny Emergence.

classFeature.name: Mana Infusion
entries: At 6th level, while transformed your attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

classFeature.name: Enhanced Ability
entries: At 7th level, you allow your essence to tap into your skills, further enhancing them. Choose two skills you are proficient in, while transformed you double your proficiency bonus for checks you make with those skills for the duration of the transformation.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Essence Form feature
entries: At 9th level, you gain a feature granted by your Essence Form.

classFeature.name: Uncanny Emergence feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Uncanny Emergence.

classFeature.name: Empowered Form
entries: At 11th level, you can push your essence further, increasing its might. When you use your Manifest feature, you can spend one additional use of your transformations to give your form the following benefits for the duration of the transformation:

items: Your form becomes Large.
You deal an extra {@dice 1d4} damage with melee and ranged attacks.
You have advantage on checks and saving throws that rely on Strength.
Your essence's hit points increases by +5.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Kindred Intuition
entries: Starting at 13th level, you and your other half are able to work together and pierce through others true intentions. You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks, and you gain {@sense truesight} up to 5 feet.

classFeature.name: Uncanny Emergence feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Uncanny Emergence.

classFeature.name: Essence Form feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Essence Form.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Unleashed Form
entries: At 17th level, you can unhinge your essence, unleashing its expansive potential. When you use your Manifest feature, you can spend two additional uses of your transformation to give your form the following benefits for the duration of the transformation:

items: Your form becomes Huge.
You deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage with melee and ranged attacks.
You have advantage on checks and saving throws that rely on Strength.
Your essence's hit points increases by +10.
You deal double damage to objects and structures.
Your reach increases by 5 feet.

classFeature.name: Uncanny Emergence feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted by your Uncanny Emergence.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Legendary Essence
entries: Starting at 20th level, you and your inner companion become a legendary duo.
Once per short or long rest, if you fail a saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead.
Your form gains access to legendary actions, included in its stat block.
Additionally, your transformation ends early only if you fall {@condition unconscious}, the form drops to 0 hit points, or if you choose to end it.

subclassFeature.name: Unhinged Alchemist
entries: Those of this origin are trained in the art of alchemy, creating amazing elixirs and strange compounds. Your work can sometimes be called mad or wicked, especially when your prime test subject is yourself. Your powers are artificial in nature, coming from your research and knowledge of transmutation and alchemy.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemical Training
entries: Beginning when you choose this emergence at 1st level, you have learned the arts of alchemy and potion making through your studies. You gain proficiency in two tools of your choice from: {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB}, {@item poisoner's kit|PHB}, or {@item herbalism kit|PHB}.
Additionally, you gain proficiency in your choice of the {@skill Medicine} or {@skill Nature} skill.

subclassFeature.name: Unstable Mixture
entries: At 1st level, you have brewed a series of unpredictable potions. When you finish a long rest, you create a number of unstable mixtures equal to your Intelligence modifier + proficiency bonus. As an action, you can throw this potion up to 30/60 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the unstable mixture as a simple weapon. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d6} + your Intelligence modifier damage, roll on the Mixture Damage table to determine the damage for that attack.
This potion's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

subclassFeature.name: Essence Brand (Alchemical)
entries: At 1st level when you choose this emergence, you can choose your forms creature type from: elemental, giant, humanoid, monstrosity, ooze, or plant.

subclassFeature.name: Easy Design
entries: At 6th level, you created a more easy to use design to your mixtures. Your throwing range for your unstable mixtures increases to 60/120 feet.
Additionally, you can now throw unstable mixtures as an action or a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Essence Elixir
entries: At 10th level, you pour your essence into your work. When you finish a short or long rest, you create one Essence Elixir. A creature can use a bonus action to drink the potion, or feed the potion to a creature to shift them into a monstrous form. While shifted, the creature gains the following effects:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws.
Your overall AC increases by +1.
You gain a number of temporary hit points equal to double your character level or CR (minimum of 2). If any of these remain when this shift ends, they are lost.

You grow claws that are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your proficiency bonus, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries: This effect lasts for 1 minute, you drop to 0 hit points or die. This elixir has no effect on constructs. If you drink this elixir instead of gaining the effects of the shift you instead transform as if you used your Manifest feature without extending a use of the feature.

subclassFeature.name: Desperate Brew
entries: At 14th level, when the time calls for it you quickly create an unpredictable elixir in a panicked brew. As an action, you can create a random potion if you have {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB} on your person. This potion lasts for 1 minute, afterwards it expires and loses its unique properties if not used due to its unstable mixture. Roll on the Makeshift Potion table below to randomly determine what potion you create.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest. You can use two uses of this feature to instead pick a potion of your choice off the table.
You can't use this feature while transformed.

subclassFeature.name: Eurika
entries: At 18th level, you made an amazing break through in your alchemical study. You gain the following effects:

items: You are immune to poison and disease.
Potions made with the Desperate Brew feature can be used as a bonus action.
You double your proficiency bonus with checks you make with your {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB}, {@item poisoner's kit|PHB}, and {@item herbalism kit|PHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Altered Mage
entries: Vessels of this origin are trained in the arcane arts and more. Your essence comes from rituals and other magical infusions of usually dark magics that were forced upon you. You harness energy from your essence to empower yourself and so does it in return.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Beginning when you choose this emergence at 1st level, your ancient connection to elder magic has given you the ability to cast spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter warlock spell list|spells|level=0|class=Warlock}. You learn an additional warlock cantrip of your choice at 12th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Altered Mage Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your warlock spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell witch bolt} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell witch bolt} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know one 1st-level warlock spell of your choice.

The Spells Known column of the Altered Mage Spellcasting table shows when you learn more warlock spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 10th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the warlock spells you know with another spell of your choice from the warlock spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your warlock spells, since you develop your spells, your connection with the entity inside you, and your arcane teachings. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a warlock spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Innate Power
entries: At 1st level, your power flows from the essence within. You can cast spells without using material components if it doesn't have a coin cost.

subclassFeature.name: Essence Brand (Arcane)
entries: At 1st level when you choose this emergence, you can choose your form's creature type from: aberration, elemental, fey, fiend, humanoid, or monstrosity.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Shell
entries: At 6th level, your essence enhances your protection against magic. You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, you have resistance to force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Syphon Essence
entries: At 10th level, you tap into your essence to empower your spells. When you cast a spell that does damage, you can add your Form Strike die to the spell's damage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Sense
entries: Starting at 14th level, you gain a taste for magic. You can cast {@spell detect magic} at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.
You can cast this even while transformed.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Burden
entries: At 18th level, you share your concentration with your essence. You can concentrate on two spells at once, if at least one spell is targeted only towards yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Curse
entries: Some become afflicted by primal or fey curses, primarily lycanthropy. A vessel of this origin contains a feral essence that is not so easy to control. They use this curse to rip through foes and dribble on the balance of man or monster.

subclassFeature.name: Fey Resilience
entries: Beginning when you choose this emergence at 1st level, your curse grants your essence a high level of fortitude. While transformed, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage you take from nonmagical attacks not made with silver weapons are reduced by an amount equal to your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Beastly Influence
entries: At 1st level, your essence opens your mind to new feral feelings. You gain proficiency in one skill of your choiec from: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Stealth}.

Additionally, you have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with beasts. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return if they cannot speak.

subclassFeature.name: Essence Brand (Untamed)
entries: At 1st level when you choose this emergence, you can choose your forms creature type from: beast, dragon, fey, fiend, humanoid, or monstrosity.

subclassFeature.name: Favored Prey
entries: At 6th level, you've developed a taste for particular kinds of creatures. Choose two types of creatures: aberrations, beasts, celestials, constructs, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, giants, monstrosities, oozes, plants, or undead. Alternatively, you can select two races of humanoids (such as kenku and humans) as favored prey.

items: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival} and {@skill Perception}) checks to track your favored prey.
You have advantage on attack rolls against your favored prey if they are {@condition frightened}.
You have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks against your favored prey.

entries: Each time you level in this class, you can change your two favored prey.

subclassFeature.name: Imposing Display
entries: At 10th level, you can let out a fearsome roar. As an action, you let out a roar. Any hostile or surprised creature within 60 feet of you that can see or hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or become {@condition frightened} by you until the end of your next turn.
While transformed, creatures have disadvantage on this saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Ferocious Rush
entries: At 14th level, nothing shall hold back your feral wrath. You gain the following benefits:

items: You ignore difficult terrain.
You have advantage against effects that would restrain or paralyze you.
You add your Strength modifier to your initiative roll (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Sustaining Essence
entries: At 18th level, your lycanthropic powers preserve your being. While in combat, at the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to your Constitution modifier if you have no more than half of your hit points left. You don't gain this benefit if you have 0 points, or if you have been damaged by a silvered weapon on your last turn.
Additionally, for every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year.

subclassFeature.name: Brute
entries: Your essence embodies strength. They resemble bulky and thick forms such as something similar to ogres or owlbears.

subclassFeature.name: Brute Form
entries: When you gain this essence at 1st level, you gain the form of a towering brute. The statblock below is the statistics adopt when you use your Manifest feature.

data.name: Brute Form

hp.special: your Constitution modifier + six times your vessel level

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The form has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

trait.name: Powerful Build
entries: The form counts as one size larger when determining its carrying capacity and the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The form's long jump is up to 20 ft. and its high jump is up to 40 ft., with or without a running start.

trait.name: Overwhelming Might (9th level)
entries: The form's strength is unmatched. The form gains a +2 bonus to any skill check, saving throw, attack, and damage roll that uses Strength.

action.name: Multiattack (5th level)
entries: The form makes two attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Riot (15th level)
entries: Your essence becomes unhinged. When the form reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the form can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a slam attack.

legendaryHeader: At 20th level, the form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one slam attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

subclassFeature.name: Overwhelming Might
entries: The form's strength is unmatched. The form gains a +2 bonus to any skill check, saving throw, attack, and damage roll that uses Strength.

subclassFeature.name: Riot
entries: Your essence becomes unhinged. When the form reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the form can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a slam attack.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

entries.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one slam attack.

entries.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

subclassFeature.name: Lycan
entries: Your essence resembles the stealthy and pack hunting creatures such as wolves and hyenas.

subclassFeature.name: Lycan Form
entries: When you gain this essence at 1st level, you gain the form of a canine creature. The statblock below is the statistics you adopt when you use your Manifest feature.

data.name: Lycan Form

hp.special: your Constitution modifier + six times your vessel level

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The form has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Speak with Wolves
entries: The form can communicate simple concepts to {@creature wolf|MM|wolves} and similar creatures when it speaks in Common.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The form has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the form's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Strength of the Pack (9th level)
entries: The pack prevails. Allies within 10 ft. of the form gain advantage on Strength and Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Advanced Hunter (15th level)
entries: The form becomes in tune with its predatory nature. When the form hits a creature with a bite attack, it must succeed on a DC (8 + PB + your Strength modifier) Strength saving throw, or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack (5th level)
entries: The form makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier slashing damage.

legendaryHeader: At 20th level, the form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one bite or one claw attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

subclassFeature.name: Strength of the Pack
entries: The pack prevails. Allies within 10 ft. of the form gain advantage on Strength and Wisdom saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Hunter
entries: The form becomes in tune with its predatory nature. When the form hits a creature with a bite attack, it must succeed on a DC (8 + PB + your Strength modifier) Strength saving throw, or be knocked {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

entries.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one bite or one claw attack.

entries.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

subclassFeature.name: Araneae
entries: Your essence is a creeping horror that spits webs to trap prey and control their environment.

subclassFeature.name: Araneae Form
entries: When you gain this essence at 1st level, you gain the form of a creeping spider like creature. The statblock below is the statistics you adopt when you use your Manifest feature.

data.name: Araneae Form

hp.special: your Constitution modifier + four times your vessel level

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The form can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the form knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The form ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

trait.name: Advanced Arachnid (9th level)
entries: The form's hunting abilities sharpen. The form gains {@sense blindsight} up to 10 feet, and its Web range increases to 30/60 feet.

trait.name: Venomous Bite (15th level)
entries: Venom fills the form's mandibles. If the form bites a creature that is {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}, they must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + PB + your Constitution modifier) or take poison damage equal to your PB and become {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

action.name: Multiattack (5th level)
entries: The form makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier piercing damage.

action.name: Web {@recharge}
entries: {@atk rw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, 15/30 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The creature is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature can make a DC (8 + PB + Constitution modifier) Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The effect also ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10 + PB, hit points equal to your Vessel level, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage.

legendaryHeader: At 20th level, the form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one bite attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Arachnid
entries: The form's hunting abilities sharpen. The form gains {@sense blindsight} up to 10 feet, and its Web range increases to 30/60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Venomous Bite
entries: Venom fills the form's mandibles. If the form bites a creature that is {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}, they must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + PB + your Constitution modifier) or take poison damage equal to your PB and become {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

entries.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one bite attack.

entries.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

subclassFeature.name: Horned
entries: Your essence embodies an unstoppable force, using their spiked body to blow through obstacles.

subclassFeature.name: Horned Form
entries: When you gain this essence at 1st level, you gain the form of a horned or tusked creature. The statblock below is the statistics you adopt when you use your Manifest feature.

data.name: Horned Form

hp.special: your Constitution modifier + six times your vessel level

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the form moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC (8 + PB + Constitution modifier) Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The form has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Devastating Ram (9th level)
entries: The form rushes at foes with heavy force. When the form uses its Charge trait, the creature takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage from the Gore attack.
Additionally, if a creature fails the Strength saving throw from your Charge trait, they are also pushed back 5 feet if they are your size or smaller.

action.name: Multiattack (5th level)
entries: The form makes two attacks.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier piercing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Stomp (15th level)
entries: Your essence tramples your foes. When the form knocks a creature {@condition prone} with its Charge trait, the form can make one slam attack against it as a reaction.

legendaryHeader: At 20th level, the form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one gore or one slam attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

subclassFeature.name: Devastating Ram
entries: The form rushes at foes with a heavy force. WHen the form uses its Charge trait, the creature takes an extra {@dice 1d6} damage from the Gore attack.
Additionally, if a creature fails the Strength saving throw from your Charge trait, they are also pushed back 5 feet if they are your size or smaller.

subclassFeature.name: Stomp
entries: Your essence tramples your foes. When the form knocks a creature {@condition prone} with its Charge trait, the form can make one slame attack against it as a reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

entries.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one gore or one slam attack.

entries.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

subclassFeature.name: Avian
entries: Your essence contains the power of flight and all the freeing elements that come with it, the form often resembling a flying beast.

subclassFeature.name: Avian Form
entries: When you gain this essence at 1st level, you gain the form of a great bird or other flying creature. The statblock below is the statistics you adopt when you use your Manifest feature.

data.name: Avian Form

hp.special: your Constitution modifier + four times your vessel level

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The form has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Light Bones
entries: When the form takes damage as a result of falling, the form reduces the damage taken by an amount equal to your Constitution modifier + PB.

trait.name: Death from Above (9th level)
entries: The form takes to the skies. The form gains a flight speed of 60 feet.

trait.name: Dive Bomb (15th level)
entries: Drop down on foes with ease. If the form is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a talon, the attack deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage to the target.
Additionally, the form doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack (5th level)
entries: The form makes two attacks.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier slashing damage.

legendaryHeader: At 20th level, the form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one beak or one talon attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

subclassFeature.name: Death from Above
entries: The form takes to the skies. The form gains a flight speed of 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Dive Bomb
entries: Drop down on foes with ease. If the form is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a talon, the attack deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage to the target.
Additionally, the form doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

entries.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one beak or one talon attack.

entries.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

subclassFeature.name: Aquatic
entries: Your essence is connected to the tides and the creatures that dwell within it from the simple minnow to the mighty kraken.

subclassFeature.name: Aquatic Form
entries: When you gain this essence at 1st level, you gain the form of an aquatic or amphibious creature. The statblock below is the statistics you adopt when you use your Manifest feature.

data.name: Aquatic Form

hp.special: your Constitution modifier + six times your vessel level

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The form can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Underwater Camouflage
entries: The form has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide while underwater.

trait.name: Thrashing Jaws (15th level)
entries: Thrash foes with the power of the waves. When the form hits a creature with a bite attack, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 8} + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

action.name: Multiattack (5th level)
entries: The form makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier slashing damage.

bonus.name: Marine Agility (9th level)
entries: The form's swimming prowess increases. While swimming, the form can take either the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Dodge} actions as a bonus action while submerged in water.

legendaryHeader: At 20th level, the form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one bite or one claw attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

subclassFeature.name: Marine Agility
entries: The form's swimming prowess increases. While swimming, the form can take either the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Dodge} actions as a bonus action while submerged in water.

subclassFeature.name: Thrashing Jaws
entries: Thrash foes with the power of the waves. When the form hits a creature with a bite attack, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

entries.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one bite or one claw attack.

entries.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

monster.name: Brute Form

hp.special: your Constitution modifier + six times your vessel level

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The form has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

trait.name: Powerful Build
entries: The form counts as one size larger when determining its carrying capacity and the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The form's long jump is up to 20 ft. and its high jump is up to 40 ft., with or without a running start.

trait.name: Overwhelming Might (9th level)
entries: The form's strength is unmatched. The form gains a +2 bonus to any skill check, saving throw, attack, and damage roll that uses Strength.

action.name: Multiattack (5th level)
entries: The form makes two attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Riot (15th level)
entries: Your essence becomes unhinged. When the form reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the form can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a slam attack.

legendaryHeader: At 20th level, the form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one slam attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

monster.name: Lycan Form

hp.special: your Constitution modifier + six times your vessel level

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The form has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Speak with Wolves
entries: The form can communicate simple concepts to {@creature wolf|MM|wolves} and similar creatures when it speaks in Common.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The form has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the form's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Strength of the Pack (9th level)
entries: The pack prevails. Allies within 10 ft. of the form gain advantage on Strength and Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Advanced Hunter (15th level)
entries: The form becomes in tune with its predatory nature. When the form hits a creature with a bite attack, it must succeed on a DC (8 + PB + your Strength modifier) Strength saving throw, or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack (5th level)
entries: The form makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier slashing damage.

legendaryHeader: At 20th level, the form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one bite or one claw attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

monster.name: Araneae Form

hp.special: your Constitution modifier + four times your vessel level

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The form can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the form knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The form ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

trait.name: Advanced Arachnid (9th level)
entries: The form's hunting abilities sharpen. The form gains {@sense blindsight} up to 10 feet, and its Web range increases to 30/60 feet.

trait.name: Venomous Bite (15th level)
entries: Venom fills the form's mandibles. If the form bites a creature that is {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}, they must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + PB + your Constitution modifier) or take poison damage equal to your PB and become {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

action.name: Multiattack (5th level)
entries: The form makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier piercing damage.

action.name: Web {@recharge}
entries: {@atk rw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, 15/30 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The creature is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature can make a DC (8 + PB + Constitution modifier) Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The effect also ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10 + PB, hit points equal to your Vessel level, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage.

legendaryHeader: At 20th level, the form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one bite attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

monster.name: Horned Form

hp.special: your Constitution modifier + six times your vessel level

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the form moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC (8 + PB + Constitution modifier) Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The form has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Devastating Ram (9th level)
entries: The form rushes at foes with heavy force. When the form uses its Charge trait, the creature takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage from the Gore attack.
Additionally, if a creature fails the Strength saving throw from your Charge trait, they are also pushed back 5 feet if they are your size or smaller.

action.name: Multiattack (5th level)
entries: The form makes two attacks.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier piercing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} your Charisma modifier + PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d8}) + Charisma modifier bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Stomp (15th level)
entries: Your essence tramples your foes. When the form knocks a creature {@condition prone} with its Charge trait, the form can make one slam attack against it as a reaction.

legendaryHeader: At 20th level, the form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one gore or one slam attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

legendaryHeader: At 20th level, the form can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The form makes one bite or onw claw attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The form moves up to half its speed.

entries.name: The Vessel
entries: A circle of cultists surround a weak gnome sitting in a ritual circle. Their chains summon eldritch magic that seeps into the gnome giving them magic, as well as shifting them into a horrible abomination. The magic puts the gnome into a terrifying rage, who lashes out with tendrils, killing the cultists.

Two bandits corner a mature elf in an alley, holding their daggers close to the elf's neck. Fur rips through their would-be victim's skin, and hands melt into deadly claws, and the elft's shadow grows, looming over them. It's too late for the bandits; their fate is sealed.

A meek alchemist ponders over a glowing vial, and after a moment of doubt, he drinks the whole thing. After a moment of silence, his body twists and contorts into a mass of flesh and tentacles, only barely resembling a man.
Unpredictable, uncanny, able to shift into a mockery of themselves and split between two forms. When you're a vessel, you're never truly alone.

entries.name: Warp Spasms
entries: A vessel, as the name suggests, is a carrier, a host to a strange essence of power. This power can sometimes be another entity or consciousness. Vessels permit it to take over their body, transforming them into a physical manifestation of their power. This form enhances their abilities and grants them new ones; even in their normal form, its power leaks into their everyday life. This essence can shift their vessels into a variety of shapes based on the essence's nature, from an imposing beast to a horrible abomination. They also use this new form for a variety of needs, from battle to traveling. The vessel and their essence grow together, unlocking potential in each other.

entries.name: Duality of One
entries: Vessels are uncommon in the many worlds of D&D. They share their existence with a sentient force within them that has their own goals, bonds, and flaws. This force can drive a vessel to learn more about their situation, being consumed by it, embrace it, or rid themselves of it. They are considered some form of shapechanger, that master a single form such as a lycanthrope.

The source of this essence varies greatly and is never so simple. Their powers are mostly if not always accidental and unpredictable. Some search for this power through magical curses and rituals, or even more artificial alchemical means.

entries.name: Creating a Vessel
entries: The origin of your vessel is crucial to its development. Work with your DM when deciding how your character gained this ability and the characteristics of your manifestation. Some of the more important details to consider are when, where, and how you gained your power.

Think about their relationship with this essence. Do they love it, hate it, or maybe even fear it? Along with that, how does your monster feel about you? Do they see you as dead weight, a friend, or an enemy? Maybe they want to get rid of you altogether. Also, how do they act? Tame, vicious, quirky? Think of their bonds, flaws, and alignment.

Like your character's appearance, describing how your manifestation looks is also very important. Your form should complement the Essence Form you pick. The transformation from man to the monster is significant too. Is it unpleasant or torturous? Is there a unique sequence you go through? Does your character remember what happens when you transform? Does your character have any sway over its actions?

entries.name: Essence Quirks
entries: Your freakish alternative form can have odd or uncanny personalities, giving them quirks to make them distinct from your normal form. You can use the following table to customize your character's essence in addition to the trait, ideal, bond, and flaw from your background.

rows: They always need something to chew on.
They speak in the third person.
They have odd primal urges and often act animalistic.
They are completely unable to lie.
They have trouble showing or understanding emotion.
Incredibly afraid of mirrors and will do anything to avoid them.
All food is finger food to them.
The more people there are, the quieter they are.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a vessel quickly by following these suggestions. First, put your highest ability score in Constitution, followed by Charisma. Second, choose the {@background hermit|PHB} background.
